newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Venezuela's Banco Mercantil buys 8 Latino branches.
newsitem.headline: Venezuela's Banco Mercantil buys 8 Latino branches.

text.p: Venezuela's second largest bank Banco Mercantil bought eight branches of state bank Banco Latino with a bid of 12.157 billion bolivars ($25.2 million), state Deposits Guarantee Fund Fogade said.
Mecantil beat out rival Banco Provincial, Venezuela's leading bank, which offered 10.53 billion bolivars for the branches. Fogade had set a base price of 4.883 billion bolivars.
"This group of offices is very interesting for our strategy of expansion," Pedro Vegas, Mercantil's manager of commercial banking, told reporters.
Six of the eight branches are located in the capital Caracas and the other two in the southeastern state of Bolivar.
Fogade plans to sell a total of 44 Latino branches over the next week. A second group of nine branches will be auctioned this afternoon.
